topic: How to combine idlelib with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine idlelib with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Idlelib and Typing for Production-Grade Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates the integration of Idlelib and Type Hints to enhance the readability, maintainability, and type safety of your production code in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Leverage Type Hints for better code comprehension
Utilize advanced Python features available in version 3.12 and above

code_examples.code:
from typing import TypedDict, List

class MyData(TypedDict):
    id: int
    name: str
    values: List[float]

def process_data(data: MyData):
    pass

version_notes: Idlelib v0.7.2 (and later versions) is required
caveats: Ensure you have the necessary permissions to use Idle's internal libraries in your project
Always test thoroughly before deploying updated or new code to production environments
